statements: SELECT * FROM researcher_healthcare_data LIMIT 5;
SELECT researcher_name, research_topic FROM researcher_healthcare_data WHERE researcher_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM researcher_healthcare_data WHERE research_topic LIKE 'Cancer%';
SELECT researcher_id, researcher_name FROM researcher_healthcare_data ORDER BY researcher_name DESC;
SELECT researcher_id, researcher_name, LENGTH(healthcare_data) AS data_length FROM researcher_healthcare_data WHERE LENGTH(healthcare_data) > 100;
SELECT researcher_name, healthcare_data FROM researcher_healthcare_data WHERE researcher_id = 1;
SELECT DISTINCT research_topic FROM researcher_healthcare_data ORDER BY researcher_name DESC;
SELECT researcher_id, researcher_name, research_topic FROM researcher_healthcare_data WHERE researcher_name LIKE 'J%' AND research_topic IN ('Cancer Research', 'Heart Disease');
SELECT * FROM researcher_healthcare_data WHERE research_topic = 'Diabetes Research' AND researcher_name LIKE '%son' ORDER BY researcher_id ASC;
SELECT COUNT(research_topic) AS topic_count, research_topic FROM researcher_healthcare_data GROUP BY research_topic HAVING COUNT(research_topic) > 1 ORDER BY topic_count DESC;
SELECT researcher_id, researcher_name, department FROM Researchers;
SELECT * FROM Researchers WHERE department = 'Medical';
SELECT researcher_name, department FROM Researchers ORDER BY department DESC;
SELECT data_id, patient_id, disease_type, outcome FROM HealthcareData WHERE outcome = 'Positive';
SELECT researcher_name, department FROM Researchers WHERE department = 'Biology' ORDER BY researcher_name ASC;
SELECT researcher_name, department FROM Researchers WHERE researcher_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM HealthcareData WHERE disease_type = 'Cancer' AND outcome = 'Positive' ORDER BY data_id DESC;
SELECT researcher_name, COUNT(researcher_id) AS research_count FROM Researchers GROUP BY researcher_name;
SELECT researcher_name AS researcher, department AS dept FROM Researchers WHERE department = 'Cardiology' ORDER BY researcher_name ASC;
SELECT patient_id, COUNT(data_id) AS data_count FROM HealthcareData GROUP BY patient_id HAVING COUNT(data_id) > 2;
SELECT * FROM Researchers;
SELECT researcher_name, researcher_email FROM Researchers ORDER BY researcher_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM HealthcareData WHERE data_value > 100;
SELECT * FROM DiseaseOutcomes WHERE outcome_description LIKE '%positive%';
SELECT researcher_name, researcher_email FROM Researchers WHERE researcher_id = 3;
SELECT researcher_name, researcher_email FROM Researchers;
SELECT * FROM Researchers ORDER BY researcher_name DESC;
SELECT disease_id, AVG(data_value) AS average_value FROM HealthcareData GROUP BY disease_id;
SELECT R.researcher_name, D.outcome_description FROM Researchers R JOIN DiseaseOutcomes D ON R.researcher_id = D.outcome_id;
SELECT researcher_name, COUNT(*) AS num_records FROM Researchers GROUP BY researcher_name HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
SELECT * FROM Researchers;
SELECT name, email FROM Researchers WHERE affiliation = 'University';
SELECT trend_name, research_area FROM Trends WHERE researcher_id = 1;
SELECT pattern_description FROM DiseasePatterns WHERE trend_id = 3;
SELECT diagnosis, outcome FROM HealthcareData WHERE patient_id = 100;
SELECT * FROM Researchers WHERE name LIKE 'John%'
SELECT patient_id, diagnosis FROM HealthcareData ORDER BY diagnosis DESC
SELECT * FROM Trends WHERE research_area='Public Health' OR research_area='Epidemiology'
SELECT R.name, D.diagnosis, T.trend_name FROM Researchers R JOIN HealthcareData D ON R.id = D.patient_id JOIN Trends T ON R.id = T.researcher_id
SELECT * FROM DiseasePatterns WHERE pattern_description LIKE '%symptoms%'
SELECT * FROM researchers;
SELECT researcher_name, research_area FROM researchers;
SELECT study_name, study_date FROM studies WHERE study_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT patient_name, age, gender FROM patients WHERE gender = 'Male';
SELECT diagnosis_id, disease_name, diagnosis_date FROM diagnoses ORDER BY diagnosis_date DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM researchers
SELECT researcher_name, research_area FROM researchers WHERE researcher_id = 1
SELECT study_name, study_date FROM studies ORDER BY study_date DESC
SELECT patient_name, age, gender FROM patients WHERE gender = 'Male'
SELECT researcher_name, study_name, outcome_result FROM researchers JOIN studies ON researchers.researcher_id = studies.researcher_id JOIN outcomes ON studies.study_id = outcomes.study_id
